properties.areaDesc: Russell; Sevier Smoky Mountains; Southeast Monroe; Southeast Carter; Blount Smoky Mountains; Unicoi; Wise; Johnson; Southeast Greene; Cocke Smoky Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 7 at 4:29AM EST until February 7 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Morristown TN
properties.description:
...Accumulating snowfall expected across the northern Plateau and
higher elevations of East Tennessee and southwest Virginia early
this morning through mid afternoon...

Cold air will continue to spill into the region this morning
behind a cold front and rain will change to snow across the
Plateau, and higher elevations of east Tennessee and southwest
Virginia. As an upper level trough swings through the area,
widespread precipitation this morning will become more isolated
by the afternoon hours as the trough lifts out of the area.

Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are expected with locally
higher amounts up to 5 inches possible across the highest
elevations of the Smoky Mountains.

* WHAT...Rain mixed with and changing to snow early this morning.
Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches but up to 5 inches
across the highest elevations of the Smoky Mountains.

* WHERE...Wise and Russell Counties of southwest Virginia and
far east Tennessee Mountains.

* WHEN...From 1 AM to 4 PM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON
